activities:
Inteva Products, LLC obtains personal data from the European Union (EU)/European Economic Area (EEA) in order to operate, maintain and to conduct business. 

Inteva Products, LLC may process certain personal information from the EEA from or pertaining to 

1. customers, business partners, freelancers, prospects, independent contractors or suppliers 
- to help customers and business partners complete a transaction or order 
- to deliver products/services 
- to provide customers and business partners with information and services 
- to bill for purchased products/services 
- to provide ongoing service and support 
- to contact customers and business partners to complete surveys that are used for marketing and quality assurance purposes	 
- to facilitate communication	 
- to select service and personnel 
- to book travel, accommodation and event registration 
- for business continuity and /or disaster recovery procedures  

2. employees and candidates for employment (human resources data) 

- to implement compensation and benefits programs 
- for employee development planning and review 
- for performance appraisals	 
- for training purposes 
- for administration of business travel and expenses 
- for administration of access to Inteva facilities and computer networks 
- to maintain internal employee directories 
- to consider candidates for employment opportunities within Inteva
- to help Inteva personnel better understand the needs and interests of business partners and customers 
- to aid communication
- to handle emergencies
eucountries: Czech Republic, France, Germany, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Netherlands, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, Spain, United Kingdom
personaldata: Organization, clients, customers, business partners, freelancers, prospects, independent contractors, suppliers and employees
